sen.j: 牧野 権六郎（まきの ごんろくろう、文政2年8月2日 (旧暦)（1819年9月20日） - 明治2年6月28日 (旧暦)（1869年8月5日））は、幕末の備前国・岡山藩士で尊王攘夷の志士である。
sen.e: Gonrokuro MAKINO (September 20, 1819 - August 5, 1869) was a feudal retainer of Okayama in Bizen province and patriot of Sonno Joi (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in the end of Edo period.

Gonrokuro MAKINO (September 20, 1819 - August 5, 1869) was a feudal retainer of Okayama in Bizen province and patriot of Sonno Joi (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in the end of Edo period.

Gonrokuro MAKINO (September 20, 1819 - August 5, 1869) was a feudal retainer of Okayama in Bizen Province and patriot of Sonno Joi (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 幼名は孝三郎、名は成憲。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kozaburo and another name was Seiken.
His childhood name was Kozaburo and another name was Seiken.
His childhood name was Kozaburo and another name was Seiken.

sen.j: 遠祖は、三河国の牧野信成 (今橋城主)。
sen.e: His forefather was Nobushige MAKINO in Mikawa province (the lord of Imabashi-jo Castle).
His forefather was Nobushige MAKINO in Mikawa province (the lord of Imabashi-jo Castle).
His forefather was Nobushige MAKINO in Mikawa Province (the lord of Imabashi-jo Castle).
sen.cmt: Mikawa province→Mikawa Provinceに修正しました。

sen.j: その孫の牧野宇右衛門が、池田輝政に召しだされたことが、先祖の池田家仕官の由緒である。
sen.e: Uemon MAKINO, Nobushige's grandson, was summoned by Terumasa IKEDA and this is the history of serving the master by the Ikeda family, his ancestor.
Uemon MAKINO, Nobushige's grandson, was summoned by Terumasa IKEDA and this is the history of his ancestor's serving for the Ikeda family.
sen.cmt: and 以下が原文の意味と相違していたので訂正しました。
sen.e: Uemon MAKINO, Nobushige's grandson, was summoned by Terumasa IKEDA and this is the history of his ancestor's serving for the Ikeda family.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）11月14日、江戸幕府より黒船来航のため岡山藩に房総警備（「北条（千葉県館山市北条）」と「竹ヶ岡（鏡ヶ浦・千葉県館山市八幡）」・安政5年（1858年）6月まで続いた）の命令が下ったので参謀長格で岡山から現地に赴いたが、房総の大津絵節（名所名物の唄）を作り兵士と共に毎日酒宴を開き騒いだり、総司令官の伊木忠澄も茶の湯遊びに耽っていたため、部下の香川忠武が池田慶政に士風刷新（綱紀粛正）の建白書を提出する騒ぎにまでしている。
sen.e: In November 14, 1853, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) ordered Okayama domain to guard Boso ('Hojo' [Hojo, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture] and 'Takegaoka' [Kagamigaura and Yawata, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture], which continued until June 1858) due to the arrival of the Black Ships, and thereby Gonrokuro moved from Okayama to the field as the chief of staff, but he caused a mess such as making Boso Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture) Song (a song of famous places and products) and holding a wild drinking party with soldiers every day, and even Tadazumi Igi, the commander in chief, indulged in a tea ceremony, and therefore, Tadatake KAGAWA, Igi's subordinate, submitted a petition of reformation in samurai (warrior) style (enforcement of official discipline) to Yoshimasa IKEDA.

In November 14, 1853, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) ordered Okayama domain to guard Boso ('Hojo' [Hojo, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture] and 'Takegaoka' [Kagamigaura and Yawata, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture], which continued until June 1858) due to the arrival of the Black Ships, and thereby Gonrokuro moved from Okayama to the spot as the chief of staff, but he caused a mess such as making Boso Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture) Song (a song of famous places and products) and holding a wild drinking party with soldiers every day, and even Tadazumi Igi, the commander in chief, indulged in a tea ceremony, and therefore, Tadatake KAGAWA, Igi's subordinate, submitted a petition of reformation in samurai (warrior) style (enforcement of official discipline) to Yoshimasa IKEDA.
sen.cmt: field を spot に訂正しました。
sen.e: In December 14, 1853, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) ordered Okayama Domain to guard Boso ('Hojo' [Hojo, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture] and 'Takegaoka' [Kagamigaura and Yawata, Tateyama City, Chiba Prefecture], which continued until July 1858) due to the arrival of the Black Ships, and thereby Gonrokuro moved from Okayama to the spot as the chief of staff, but he caused a mess such as making Boso Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture) Song (a song of famous places and products) and holding a wild drinking party with soldiers every day, and even Tadazumi Igi, the commander in chief, indulged in a tea ceremony, and therefore, Tadatake KAGAWA, Igi's subordinate, submitted a petition of reformation in samurai (warrior) style (enforcement of official discipline) to Yoshimasa IKEDA.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。domain →Domainに修正しました。

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）8月、慶政に左大臣・一条忠香より密使を通じて「朝命を拝し国事周旋せよ」との依頼あり、同年10月も朝廷より「周旋報国の勅命」を受けたが慶政は佐幕派と尊攘派の板挟みとなり、また病気も患っていたため動きが取れなかった。
sen.e: In August 1862, Yoshimasa was requested by Tadaka ICHIJO, Minister of the Left, to 'receive the order of Imperial court and procure the state affairs' through a secret agent and also received an 'Imperial order to procure and devote the country' from the Imperial Court in October 1862, but Yoshimasa was caught in the middle of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun) and the sonjo (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) party, and moreover, could not move due to illness.

In August 1862, Yoshimasa was requested by Tadaka ICHIJO, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), to 'receive the order of Imperial court and procure the state affairs' through a secret agent and also received an 'Imperial order to procure and devote the country' from the Imperial Court in October 1862, but Yoshimasa was caught in the middle of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun) and the sonjo (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) party, and moreover, could not move due to illness.
sen.cmt: Sadaijin を英文の説明の前に追加し、説明文を括弧でくくりました。（指示の通り）
sen.e: In August 1862, Yoshimasa was requested by Tadaka ICHIJO, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), to 'receive the order of Imperial court and procure the state affairs' through a secret agent and also received an 'Imperial order to procure and devote the country' from the Imperial Court in October 1862, but Yoshimasa was caught in the middle of the Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun) and the sonjo (advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) party, and moreover, could not move due to illness.

sen.j: そのため、尊攘派であった権六郎は土倉一善（家老）・土肥隆平（番頭）・伊東与一郎（側児小姓頭）・江見鋭馬（弓 (武器)組士）らとともに独自に国事周旋方として京都に上洛して活動を始めたが、忠香は岡山藩主と連携して薩摩藩・長州藩を抑えて朝廷での主導権をとる目論見があったが思うようにいかないため「慶政を隠居させるように」と激怒したという。
sen.e: Therefore, Gonrokuro who belonged to the sonjo party went up to Kyoto and started activities uniquely as an official to procure the state affairs together with Ichizen TOKURA (senior retainer), Ryuhei DOI (head clerk), Yoichiro ITO (head of the servants), Eima EMI (archer), etc., but it is said that Tadaka was outraged and said to 'have Yoshimasa retire' because his scheme to grasp the initiative in the Imperial Court suppressing Satsuma and Choshu domains by linking with the lord of Okayama domain did not work well as he planned.

Therefore, Gonrokuro who belonged to the sonjo party went up to Kyoto and started activities uniquely as an official to procure the state affairs together with Ichizen TOKURA (senior retainer), Ryuhei DOI (head clerk), Yoichiro ITO (head of the servants), Eima EMI (archer), etc., but it is said that Tadaka was outraged and said to 'have Yoshimasa retire' because his scheme to grasp the initiative in the Imperial Court suppressing Satsuma and Choshu domains by linking with the lord of Okayama domain did not work well as he planned.

Therefore, Gonrokuro who belonged to the sonjo party went up to Kyoto and started activities uniquely as an official to procure the state affairs together with Ichizen TOKURA (senior retainer), Ryuhei DOI (head clerk), Yoichiro ITO (head of the servants), Eima EMI (archer), etc., but it is said that Tadaka was outraged and said to 'have Yoshimasa retire' because his scheme to grasp the initiative in the Imperial Court suppressing Satsuma and Choshu domains by linking with the lord of Okayama Domain did not work well as he planned.

sen.j: その後、池田政詮を名代にたてて京都で活動したが藩主自らが先頭に立つ薩長相手に思うようにいかなかったので、慶政を隠居に追い込むこととしたが慶政の息子・池田鼎五郎は暗愚であるため権六郎と江見は一条忠香に相談に伺い、忠香は「水戸藩の池田茂政にせい」といったので上層部に九郎麿を養子にするようにと上申したという。
sen.e: Later, Gonrokuro was active in Kyoto with Akimasa IKEDA as the representative, but it did not work well against Satsuma and Choshu of which lord of the domain himself was in the front, so it was decided to have Yoshimasa retire, but Gonrokuro and Emi visited Tadaka ICHIJO for consultation because Teigoro IKEDA, Yoshimasa's son, was stupid, and Tadaka said to 'select Mochimasa IKEDA in Mito domain', and therefore, they submitted an opinion to the upper stratum to adopt Kuromaro.

Later, Gonrokuro was active in Kyoto with Akimasa IKEDA as the representative, but it did not work well against Satsuma and Choshu of which lord of the domain himself stood in the front, so it was decided to have Yoshimasa retire, but Gonrokuro and Emi visited Tadaka ICHIJO for consultation because Teigoro IKEDA, Yoshimasa's son, was ingorant, and Tadaka said to 'select Mochimasa IKEDA in Mito domain', and therefore, they submitted an opinion to the upper stratum to adopt Kuromaro.
sen.cmt: was を stood に変更しました。Stupid は、表現が悪いと思われますので、ignorantに訂正しました。
sen.e: Later, Gonrokuro was active in Kyoto with Akimasa IKEDA as the representative, but it did not work well against Satsuma and Choshu of which lord of the domain himself stood in the front, so it was decided to have Yoshimasa retire, but Gonrokuro and Emi visited Tadaka ICHIJO for consultation because Teigoro IKEDA, Yoshimasa's son, was ingorant, and Tadaka said to 'select Mochimasa IKEDA in Mito Domain', and therefore, they submitted an opinion to the upper stratum to adopt Kuromaro.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）、森下景端を郡奉行（備中国）に推挙して後に自身の右腕とした。
sen.e: In 1865, Gonrokuro recommended Kagenao MORISHITA to a magistrate of the county (Bicchu Province) and later had Kagenao his own right-hand man.
In 1865, Gonrokuro recommended Kagenao MORISHITA to a magistrate of the county (Bicchu Province) and later made Kagenao his own right-hand man.
sen.cmt: had を made に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1865, Gonrokuro recommended Kagenao MORISHITA to a magistrate of the county (Bicchu Province) and later made Kagenao his own right-hand man.

sen.j: 同年、貝太鼓奉行（軍監）だった権六郎は池田茂政に藩の軍艦・武器購入のため花房義質を長崎に派遣するよう進言した。
sen.e: In 1865, Gonrokuro was a shell-drum magistrate (Assistant Deputy General) and proposed to Mochimasa IKEDA to dispatch Yoshimoto HANABUSA to Nagasaki for purchasing warships and weapons of the domain.

In the same year, Gonrokuro, a shell-drum magistrate (Assistant Deputy General), proposed to Mochimasa IKEDA to dispatch Yoshimoto HANABUSA to Nagasaki for purchasing warships and weapons of the domain.
sen.cmt: In 1865 を in the same year に訂正し、他の部分は簡潔にまとめました。
sen.e: In the same year, Gonrokuro, a shell-drum magistrate (Assistant Deputy General), proposed to Mochimasa IKEDA to dispatch Yoshimoto HANABUSA to Nagasaki for purchasing warships and weapons of the domain.

sen.j: その後、虎太郎は藩上層部にヨーロッパ留学を上申したが許可されなかったので、権六郎は藩に内密で自ら金銭を都合して慶応3年（1867年）3月5日に長崎から渡欧させたという。
sen.e: After that, Torataro applied to study in Europe to the upper stratum of the domain, but not permitted, and therefore, Gonrokuro himself collected money secretly to the domain and sent him from Nagasaki to Europe in March 5, 1867.
sen.cmt: Torataro = Yoshimoto HANABUSA, but not mentioned in:http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8A%B1%E6%88%BF%E7%BE%A9%E8%B3%AA
sen.e: After that, Torataro applied to study in Europe to the upper stratum of the domain, but not permitted, and therefore, Gonrokuro himself collected money secretly to the domain and sent him from Nagasaki to Europe in March 5, 1867.

After that, Torataro applied to study in Europe to the upper stratum of the domain, but not permitted, and therefore, Gonrokuro himself collected money secretly to the domain and sent him from Nagasaki to Europe in April 9, 1867.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）3月、岡山藩軍事御用掛となる。
sen.e: In March 1866, Gonrokuro became a military official of Okayama domain.
In March 1866, Gonrokuro became Goyogakari (a general affairs official of the Imperial Household) of Okayama domain.
sen.cmt: 御用掛は、Goyogakari (a general affairs official of the Imperial Household)にしました。
sen.e: In April 1866, Gonrokuro became Goyogakari (a general affairs official) of the miliary affairs of Okayama Domain.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。岡山藩軍事御用掛は軍事の御用掛という訳に修正しました。Goyogakari (a general affairs official of the Imperial Household)→Goyogakari (a general affairs official) of the miliary affairs of Okayama Domain.domain →Domainとしました。

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）2月8日に尊攘派に推されて藩主になった池田茂政であるが次第に迷走するようになり、実兄の徳川慶喜が征夷大将軍になると一切の朝幕間周旋の仕事から身を引いたため、国事周旋方（尊攘派）の新庄厚信・津田弘道・平井重道らが隠居を迫り万成峠（岡山市万成）から岡山城へ大砲の音を鳴らして威嚇する事件があり、茂政より役目罷免・蟄居謹慎を命ぜられたが権六郎が執りなして蟄居謹慎を解かせた。
sen.e: Mochimasa IKEDA became the lord of the domain recommended by the Sonjo-ha party in February 8, 1863, but gradually strayed and retired from the procurement work between the Shogunate and the Imperial Court when Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, his real older brother, became Seiitaishogun (great general), and after the incident that Atsunobu SHINJO, Hiromichi TSUDA, Shigemichi HIRAI, etc. in the procurement side of state affairs (Sonjo-ha) pressed to retire and threatened by the sound of a cannon from Bansei Pass (Bansei, Okayama City) to the Okayama-jo Castle, Mochimasa ordered dismissal of the role and house arrest, but Gonrokuro mediated to release from the house arrest.

Mochimasa IKEDA who was recommended by the Sonjo-ha party became the lord of the domain on February 8, 1863, but gradually strayed and when Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, his real older brother, became Seiitaishogun (great general), Mochimasa retired from the procurement work between the Shogunate and the Imperial Court, and after the incident that Atsunobu SHINJO, Hiromichi TSUDA, Shigemichi HIRAI, etc. in the procurement side of state affairs (Sonjo-ha) pressed Mochimasa to retire and threatened him by the sound of a cannon from Bansei Pass (Bansei, Okayama City) to the Okayama-jo Castle, Mochimasa ordered thier dismissal of the role and house arrest, but Gonrokuro mediated to release from the house arrest.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするために、語順を変え、言葉を補いました。日付の前の、in を on に変更しました。
sen.e: Mochimasa IKEDA who was recommended by the Sonjo-ha party became the lord of the domain on March 26, 1863, but gradually strayed and when Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, his real older brother, became Seiitaishogun (great general), Mochimasa retired from the procurement work between the Shogunate and the Imperial Court, and after the incident that Atsunobu SHINJO, Hiromichi TSUDA, Shigemichi HIRAI, etc. in the procurement side of state affairs (Sonjo-ha) pressed Mochimasa to retire and threatened him by the sound of a cannon from Bansei Pass (Bansei, Okayama City) to the Okayama-jo Castle, Mochimasa ordered thier dismissal of the role and house arrest, but Gonrokuro mediated to release from the house arrest.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）10月初旬、京都で小松帯刀・福岡孝悌・後藤象二郎・辻将曹・都筑荘蔵らと会合し、権六郎が「慶喜に将軍職を朝廷に奉還せしむるのみ」と発言し大政奉還に意思統一させたという。
sen.e: In the beginning of October 1867, he had a meeting with Tatewaki KOMATSU, Takachika FUKUOKA, Shojiro GOTO, Shoso TSUJI, Shozo TSUZUKI, etc. in Kyoto, and Gonrokuro delivered a speech that 'the only thing we should do is to have Yoshinobu return Shogunship to the Imperial Court' and unified their intention to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).

In the beginning of October 1867, Gonrokuro had a meeting with Tatewaki KOMATSU, Takachika FUKUOKA, Shojiro GOTO, Shoso TSUJI, Shozo TSUZUKI, etc. in Kyoto, and delivered a speech that 'the only thing we should do is to have Yoshinobu return Shogunship to the Imperial Court' and unified their intention to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: 最初のhe をGonrokuro に変え、次のGonrokuro は不要と思われますので削除しました。
sen.e: In the beginning of October 1867, Gonrokuro had a meeting with Tatewaki KOMATSU, Takachika FUKUOKA, Shojiro GOTO, Shoso TSUJI, Shozo TSUZUKI, etc. in Kyoto, and delivered a speech that 'the only thing we should do is to have Yoshinobu return Shogunship to the Imperial Court' and unified their intention to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).

sen.j: 10月13日、二条城で徳川慶喜に謁見して、大政奉還を建言した。
sen.e: In October 13, he had an audience with Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in the Nijo-jo Castle and proposed Taisei Hokan.
In October 13, he had an audience with Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in the Nijo-jo Castle and proposed Taisei Hokan.
In November 8, he had an audience with Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in the Nijo-jo Castle and proposed Taisei Hokan.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 翌年6月いったん隠居したが、同年7月に隠居再勤となって岡山藩軍事顧問を務め、明治2年（1869年）、同藩刑法主事上席・参政となる。
sen.e: Gonrokuro once retired in June 1868, but resumed working and served as a military adviser of Okayama domain in July 1868, and became a secretary of precedence and councilor for Penal Code of the Okayama domain in 1869.

Gonrokuro once retired in June 1868, but resumed working and served as a military adviser of Okayama domain in July 1868, and became a secretary of precedence and councilor for Penal Code of the Okayama domain in 1869.

Gonrokuro once retired in July 1868, but resumed working and served as a military adviser of Okayama domain in August 1868, and became a secretary of precedence and councilor for Penal Code of the Okayama domain in 1869.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。domain →Domainとしました。

sen.e: Gonrokuro died in 1869.
Gonrokuro died in 1869.
Gonrokuro died in 1869.
He was fifty-one years old.
Died at the age of 51.
sen.cmt: 指示通りの形に訂正しました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 51.
